After describing the scenes of the trial already past, the desertion of his brethren, and the sustaining grace of a covenant-keeping God, and 
                                                                           328
sending greeting to faithful fellow-laborers, Paul closes by commending his beloved Timothy to the guardianship of the Chief Shepherd, who, though the under-shepherds might be stricken down, would still care for his servants and his flock. 

                                               -
